cyclone.name: KATIA
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi (155 km) east of Tampico, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting eastward then southward within the Bay of Campeche, remaining well south of the Texas coast and aiming toward the central Mexican Gulf coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Mexican Gulf coast (state of Veracruz vicinity)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system is not forecast to track near the Brownsville offshore area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central Mexican Gulf coast from Tampico to Veracruz
weather_observation.first_hazard: None (only a very low chance of tropical-storm force winds)
weather_observation.wind: A slight (â‰¤6%) chance of experiencing tropical-storm-force gusts; otherwise breezy conditions only.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Brownsville area.
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant tropical-cyclone rainfall expected at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possibly higher seas and rip currents along the lower Texas coast due to distant circulation.
